meanings.definition: A disappointment or feeling of discouragement.
meanings.sent1: The movie ending was a real letdown for me.
meanings.sent2: Experiencing a letdown after losing the game is normal.
meanings.sent3: It was a letdown when the ice cream truck ran out of ice cream.
meanings.sent4: The canceled concert was a letdown for all the fans.
meanings.sent5: The letdown of not getting the job lingered for days.

meanings.definition: To lower someone's expectations or hopes.
meanings.sent1: She didn't want to letdown her friend by canceling the plans.
meanings.sent2: Parents sometimes letdown children gently to avoid disappointment.
meanings.sent3: He decided to letdown the news slowly to soften the blow.
meanings.sent4: The coach had to letdown the team about the canceled game.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to letdown the students about the field trip cancellation.

meanings.definition: To fail to meet expectations or fulfill a promise.
meanings.sent1: The company's poor service letdown many customers.
meanings.sent2: It's disappointing when a product lets you down after high expectations.
meanings.sent3: The cake letdown everyone at the party with its dryness.
meanings.sent4: The team's loss letdown their loyal fans.
meanings.sent5: The delayed delivery letdown the eager recipient.
